page.title: 11Farming in Tongue
page.content: There are only two farms in Tongue area, one being the {Home Farm }with {Tongue House,}and the other belongs to an estate and is managed. Both grow crops which are mainly used as feeding for the stock which is cattle and sheep. One farm has a large rough grazing viz.24000acres and there are six workers. The other is much smaller and there are only two workers. Cereals are not grown, the weather is generally not very good for them, but hay and silage are made. Any other arable ground in the area is {croft land, }family owned small holdings. Very little cultivation is done on these, some potatoes and turnips, but hay is made for winter feed. Some cattle are kept and many sheep.
